intro: Viola tricolor var. lloydii, commonly known as the violet lily or the three-color violet, is a strikingly beautiful flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Violaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves, which are typically heart-shaped with a deep green upper surface and a lighter underside. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of violet, blue, and white, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique coloration, it is a sought-after plant among gardeners and botanists alike.
